name: IntentQL
summary: IntentQL is an experimental specification that defines how websites can publish machine-readable intent contracts, allowing AI agents to discover what actions are supported without relying on brittle HTML scraping.
problem_statement: AI agents currently interact with websites by guessing intent from HTML structure, which is fragile, expensive, and unreliable. Websites have no standard way to declare supported actions or measure agent demand.
what_intentql_provides: A convention for publishing intent contracts via /agent.json
Clear boundaries for what is and is not supported
A measurable surface for agent discovery and interaction
how_agents_should_use_this_site: Assume no capabilities beyond those explicitly listed
Fallback to HTML only if no contract is available
non_goals: Tracking users or agents across sites
notes: IntentQL is an early-stage experiment. The specification, conventions, and endpoints may change as real-world agent usage is observed.
